quotes.quote: The cat could very well be man's best friend but would never stoop to admitting it.
There is something about the presence of a cat... that seems to take the bite out of being alone.
Cats come and go without ever leaving.
A cat bitten once by a snake dreads even rope.
The cat is mighty dignified until the dog comes by.
I have studied many philosophers and many cats. The wisdom of cats is infinitely superior.
Keep an eye on the cat and another on the frying pan.
All cats love fish but fear to wet their paws.
What greater gift than the love of a cat?
If only cats grew into kittens.
No matter how much cats fight, there always seem to be plenty of kittens.
Time spent with cats is never wasted.
Lettin' the cat outta the bag is a whole lot easier 'n puttin' it back in.
Cats are designated friends.
A cat is the only domestic animal I know who toilet trains itself and does a damned impressive job of it.
Cats are smarter than dogs. You can't get eight cats to pull a sled through snow.
Cats never strike a pose that isn't photogenic.
A cat that jumps on a hot stove will never jump on a hot stove again. Neither will it jump on a cold stove.
Cats know how to obtain food without labor, shelter without confinement, and love without penalties.
As every cat owner knows, nobody owns a cat.
Cats are always elegant.
A cat can purr its way out of anything.
Cats are at home everywhere where one feeds them.
Happy is the home with at least one cat.
A cat pent up becomes a lion.
You cannot look at a sleeping cat and feel tense.
Cats are connoisseurs of comfort.
Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a function.
Cats will outsmart dogs every time.
Scalded cats fear even cold water.
One of the ways in which cats show happiness is by sleeping.
Cats are connoisseurs of comfort.
Who will not feed the cats must feed the mice and rats.
The quiet cat catches the mouse.
It is better to feed one cat than to feed many mice.
He has a good pledge of the cat who has her skin.
Cats can obviously rise to considerable mental heights, at least when they want to satisfy their lower instincts.
Cats are rather delicate creatures and they are subject to a good many different ailments, but I never heard of one who suffered from insomnia.
Cat said, 'I am not a friend, and I am not a servant. I am the Cat who walks by himself.'
It is a very inconvenient habit of kittens...that whatever you say to them, they always purr.
Cats invented self-esteem.

All cats were at first wild, but were at length tamed by the industry of mankind; it is a Beast of prey, even the tame one, more especially the wild, it being the opinion of many nothing but a diminutive Lyon.
Scratching, petting, or rubbing to a cat is a sign of unending, in fact unendable, infancy.
The cat is not in the long run anxious to please.
Cats have a sense of humor, as is shown in their extreme love of play. A middle-aged cat will often play as unreservedly as a kitten, though he knows perfectly well it is only a game.
The cat which is a solitary beast is single-minded and goes its way alone, but, the dog, like his master, is confused in his mind.
Movement is terribly important to a  cat...Nothing works quite so well as an object of jumpable size moving away. For cats, that is virtually impossible to resist.
Cats seem to go on the principle that it never does any harm to ask for what you want.
Confront a cat with something he has never seen before and his first reaction will almost invariably be one not of fear but of curiosity.
Cat sentimentality is a human thing. Cats are indifferent, their minds can't comprehend the concept 'I shall die,' they just go on living.
Cats have a consuming passion for watching human beings.
The cat lives alone. He has no need of society. He obeys only when he wishes, he pretends to sleep the better to see and scratches everything he can scratch.
A cat is not merely diverted by everything that moves but is convinced that all nature is occupied exclusively with catering to her diversion.
Cats are autocrats of naked self-interest.
When I play with my cat, who knows whether she isn't amusing herself with me more than I am with her?
Cats, no less liquid than their shadows, / Offer no angels to the wind. / They slip, diminished, neat, through loopholes / Less than themselves.
Cats seem to go on a principle that it never does any harm to ask for what you want.
Cats, I always think, only lump into your lap to check if you are cold enough, yet, to eat.
If a fish is a movement embodied, given shape, then a cat is a diagram and pattern of subtle air.
No cat purrs unless someone is around to listen.
Cat: A deceitful animal and when enraged extremely spiteful.
A home without a cat and a well-fed, well-petted, and properly-revered cat may be a perfect home, perhaps, but how can it prove its title?

People like pets to possess the same qualities they do. Cats are irresponsible and recognize no authority, yet are completely dependent on others for their material needs. Cats cannot be made to do anything useful. Cats are mean for the fun of it. In fact, cats possess so many of the same qualities as people that it is often hard to tell the people and the cats apart.
If the cat waits for long hours, silent beside the crack of the wainscot, it is for pure pleasure. Cats do not keep the mice away; it is my belief that they preserve them for the chase.
Anyone who has lived on terms of comparative equality with a cat knows that he will show his intelligence fifty times a day. To be sure this intelligence is usually of the variety called selfish.
